alert.note: Alert for Chittenden; Lamoille; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 19 at 6:09PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Vermont and northwest Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Washington. In northwest Vermont, Chittenden and Lamoille. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Some culvert erosion on secondary roads and partial driveway washouts are also possible. Streams continue to rise and/or run high due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 605 PM EDT, Moderate to occasionally heavy rainfall continuing across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some specific locations that will experience elevated stream levels of minor flooding include... Middlesex and Duxbury in Washington County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
